meta.description: Oryx Lounge at Hamad International Airport (DOH), Terminal 1. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

location.terminalDirections: In the Duty Free South Area, take the escalators located to the northeast of the Giant Teddy Bear.

warning: Access to this lounge may be restricted, and duty free vouchers/miles may be provided for selected passengers instead.

reviews.content: Avoid if you can....access via TK C-class, wait for entry for ages whilst they process pay-on-arrival customers (4 in front of me) only to find it’s rammed full. Exact opposite of website description!
Overcrowded. Would have been a nice lounge if they would only allow passengers with status but I believe there is $ entrance which makes it too crowded. Food options were mediocre to below average.
It’s so comfortable place for transit not more than 5 hours 🙃 but staff was so helpful 5 stars to DOH ORYX CAPTAIN AMEEN MALAYSIA AIRLINES
Worth to swing by on a long stop, friendly service, not a lot of people, good amenities.

Nice size lounge. Offers wine, beer and liquor. There is a nice selection of finger foods, soup and deserts. Only two televisions one the front and one near the food. At 2130 not crowded on Wednesday.
Just in front of the Al Maha lounge, the Oryx Lounge is really worth the trip with excellent food/service/tidiness. By far less crowded and more spacious than Al Maha for the same price.
I arrived in this lounge on a Wednesday afternoon and found it almost empty. There was no wait for the women's shower. There are separate "quiet" rooms and lots of ports for charging devices.
If you can find your way to this lounge then you deserve to get in for free! Spacious, clean, good food, chargers, BUT only ONE shower?  Seriously? Great shower room, but really?
This is my third time here. Everything is great. Solid as ever. Bit noisy though and nowhere to sleep but you can enjoy the food, free shower and service. Also, a gaming room with PS3 and iMacs.

Excellent lounge..
Comfortable for family and nice shower. The drinks could be self-serve.
This is a small, but nice lounge. For breakfast they had "foul mudammas" (beans) amd scrambled eggs. A Simonelli espresso machine, and pastries. Spirits were available by order through the staff.
Good basic lounge, everything needed is available yet no sufficient quiet areas available.
Location very nice, service not so bad. Daily ticket not very cheap but it's like other Qatar lounges.
VERY expensive for what you get: crowdy, noisy, only normal chairs in one big space. A quiet room with about 6 (!!) lounge chairs. Food nice, but not special. Not worth paying for.
Very basic. One big room but that's all. Everything is in that room except few other rooms with computers and stuff.

Super expensive 50€!! Lot of other lounges in the world are really better & very cheaper..there is only 1 shower!! The air conditioning is too high, we are frozen. Chairs are not comfortable..so basic.
Good enough. Pretty good food and snack options. Staff is friendly.
Nowhere to nap or sleep. Comfortable chairs, that's it.
Very bright lounge, no chance to relax. Also alcoholic beverages by order given.
Can get busy at times but a bit too open planned for my liking. Food was OK and drink selection excellent.
Our preferred lounge when passing through Doha. Service is fantastic, rarely crowded, relaxing atmosphere and sweet drinks.
Overall fine - plenty of seats, fair food variety. Downside is the strong smell of smoke throughout.
Good food. Very large with 20 new iMacs provided for use in the work area. Sleep rooms, game room, and a family area all separated and semi noise proof.
Probably the cleanest lounge in the world. Workers are constantly cleaning everything. Food is nice, but there is not room for any privacy. It is an open lounge with people walking back and forth.
As a Mastercard premier holder, I was allowed free access. Wasn't expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food, seating and atmosphere.
Lovely modern lounge but due to Ramadan, there wasn't alcohol served, which seemed fair enough, but ...... they did not reduce the price and most of the guests were westerners.
lounge is very luxurious & has several amenities I've rarely seen. There is a smoking lounge, quiet room and family room. Food is great but selection is limited. Don't serve alcohol during Ramadan.
Well worth the $40 entry for my 7 hr layover. However, it was very crowded and entry fee seems to have increased to approx. $50. Quite a few power outlets for charging and decent food.
Fantastic. I spent 6hrs from midnight to 6am. Very nice design, good shower, and fabulous food: Arabic mezze, baklava, tasty salad bar, Nespresso pods. Will return.
Only let in by payment after 2AM. By that time service was very slow. Lots of soft drinks and snacks but it took ages for a glass of wine. Clean & comfortable but only 1 shower. Ok for price (40usd).
$40 USD gets you 6 hours. Supposed limit of 4 alcoholic bevs, not sure if it's enforced. No chairs that you can really sleep in. 1 shower in the restroom. Food was good, and plentiful.
A pleasant lounge while transferring flights. A little hard to find but quite comfortable. Bathroom facilities good, although 1 shower always in use. Good food & service I would rate as medium.
Refused entry to oneworld Sapphire passenger.
All the allure of a Costa but with slightly worse coffee (actually, the coffee isn't bad). This lounge just feels a little too much like a waiting room that good lounges transcend.
Not available flying business class!! . Was told I would be given 10000 miles but they are only good for Qatar and not valid for other oneworld loyalty programs. Disappointed.
Great place to stop. Drinks, alcohol you have to ask for, Coke and all soft drink available. Food is good and area is clean; there a few bed type loungers avaliable.

location.terminalDirections: Ground Floor, Arrivals Level, After Baggage Reclaim
Ground Floor, Arrivals Level, Before Immigration
South Node Level 2. From the Teddy Bear Area, walk straight. Take the elevator or lift on the left. The lounge is located near Gates A, B and C.
Level M, Central Zone North Node. Walk or take the train to North Node, Concourse C. Located next to the Al Mourjan Orchard Business Class Lounge.

otherLounges.name: Qatar Airways Al Mourjan Business Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: From the Duty Free South Area, go up the escalators located to the left of the Giant Teddy Bear near Eye-Q Sunglasses and the Seafood Bar Caviar House & Prunier.

otherLounges.name: Qatar Airways Al Mourjan Business Class Lounge - North
Qatar Airways Al Mourjan Orchard Business Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Level M, Central Zone North Node. Walk or take the train to North Node, Concourse C. Access the lounge via escalators to the right, located before the Oryx Garden Hotel.

otherLounges.name: Qatar Airways Al Safwa First Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: From the Duty Free South Area, go up the escalators located to the right of the Giant Teddy Bear near IN-Q Cafe and Cedar Room Cigars.

otherLounges.name: Qatar Airways First and Business Class Arrivals Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Ground Floor, Arrivals Level, after Baggage Reclaim.

otherLounges.name: Qatar Airways First and Business Class Arrivals Lounge (Before Immigration)

location.terminalDirections: Ground Floor, Arrivals Level, before Immigration.
Located in Concourse A, Level 1, Duty Free Plaza South.

otherLounges.name: Sleep n' Fly Sleep Lounge (South Node)

location.terminalDirections: Located in the luxury Duty Free area, near B Gates, 2 minutes walk from the iconic Teddy Bear sculpture, inside the corridor next to Loro Piana. The sleep 'n fly Sleep Lounge is centrally located in the heart of the transit area and in easy reach from passport control and all flight gates.

otherLounges.name: Sleep n' Fly Sleep Lounge & Showers (North Node)

location.terminalDirections: Located opposite Gates C30-31 on the lower level.
